abstract: Argentine prosecutor Gerardo Pollicita appeals Judge Daniel Rafecas's decision to dismiss criminal complaint against Pres Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner; complaint alleges she conspired to hide Iranian officials' involvement in bombing of Buenos Aires Jewish center in 1994; Pollicita, who took over case from deceased investigator Alberto Nisman, says Rafecas did not sufficiently examine case.
lead_paragraph: A prosecutor on Wednesday appealed the dismissal of a criminal complaint accusing President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner of conspiring to protect Iranians suspected in the 1994 bombing of a Jewish community center.

headline.main: Argentine President May Face More Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: Argentine President May Face More Scrutiny

snippet: A prosecutor on Wednesday appealed the dismissal of a criminal complaint accusing President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner of conspiring to protect Iranians suspected in the 1994 bombing of a Jewish community center.
